::Kluster::

Kluster turns in his command chair on the Maximal battle cruiser, The Cybertro
nian Fire. The ship has been flying through space unevenfully for quite a 
while, ever since they made the transwarp jump. He yawns. The Maximal elders 
had send The Cybertronian Fire to past earth, fearing that time would suffer 
if the predacons were victorious. Kluster looks at a scanner. They were 
nearing earth, the blue planet visible on their scanners.

Suddenly, a shock goes through the whole ship. Kluster jumps to his feet, 
looking at another scanner.

"Sir! We're being boarded!" one of the crew members yells, jumping out of his 
seat and reaching for his gun. Kluster nods, lifting his comm-link to his 
mouth.

"All personel! We're being boarded! Assume battle stations immediately!" He 
yells into it, getting out of his chair and taking out his gun.

"Close the comps!" he yells to an officer on the ship, raising his voice over 
the noise of the sudden panic. The officer nods, presses a button, and steel 
panels drop around the sides of the room, sealing the comps to they would not 
be damaged during the battle.

Sounds of gunfire and yelling reach the bridge while more Maximal soldiers 
rush out to meet the invading Predacons. An officer spins around in his 
chair, the emergency comp (the one that is not hidden by the blast panels in 
case of emergency usage) beeping. "Sir! There is a fire in the engines!"

Kluster swears. "Eject the engines!" He yells firing at a Predacon that has 
run through the doors of the bridge.

"We can't do that! We'll crash!" the officer yells, also firing at the 
Predacon, which falls over in stasis lock.

"Sure we can! Watch," Kluster says, pressing a button on the comp. A slight 
tremble runs through the ship as the engines detatch, flying off several 
hundred yards and exploding.

"Predacon vessel ... detatched," the comp beeps, Kluster looking at it to see 
what it was talking about. The Predacon ship that had supplied the predacons 
now running through their halls had been blow off by the exterior defences, 
and was now flying off toward the astroid ring.

Predacons rush into the bridge, systematically being shot by the Maximal 
soldiers as well as the interior defences. One of them pulls out an energon 
dagger.

"Die Maximal scum!" the Predacon yells, jumping at Kluster, who calmly kicks 
him into a wall, sending him into stasis lock with a shot from his gun.

A damaged Maximal stumbles into the bridge, leaking mech fluid on the floor.

"What's our situation?" Kluster asks the Maximal, helping him over to a chair.

"Not so good," the Maximal barely says, "We're being killed everywhere. But 
the Preds won't last long."

Kluster looks at the Maximal's wounds. They were obvioutly very serious, 
perhaps even fatal. "Will you be allright?" he asks.

"Yeah, I'll be fine," the Maximal says, promptly sliding from his chair as 
something explodes in his neck, killing him.

Kluster sighs, standing up and firing at another Predacon that had run into 
the bridge, sending the pred flying backwards into a wall.

"We're going into the atmosphere!" an officer yells. Kluster swears again, 
looking at the screen of the emergency comp. They were quickly heading toward 
a landmass southwest of the biggest land mass on the planet.

"All hands! Brace for impact!" he yells into his comm-link. Several seconds 
later, there is a shock, a few seconds of paninc, and then everything goes 
black.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Kluster opens his eyes. His head was hurting like it had just been pulvarised 
with an egg beater. All around him, Maximals were regaining consciousness. He 
gets to his feet, looking at the emergency comp. He blinks. The damage was 
considerably less than expected. Other than some interior damage from the 
Predacon attack, there was a little extra damage from the crash.

"Computers, open," he says, the steel panels lifting to reveal functioning 
comps. Kluster still couldn't belive the damage was little. He blinks. He 
seemed to remember giving orders during the chaos before the crash, firing 
retrol rockets, steering the ship into as best a landing as was possible 
without engines.

"Computer, how many Maximals survived?"

"11," the computer responds, in several seconds being followed by an 
explosion somewhere in the ship, "10."

Kluster swears. 40 Maximals dead! "Any preds?"

"Negative."

Well, Kluster thinks to himself, at least the Predacon attack had been fought 
back.

"Raise shields. Autoguns, EMP cannons, laser batteries on full alert."

The computer following his orders, Kluster sits down at his command chair, 
sending a distress signal to the other maximals on the planet.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
(Following are The Cybertronian Fire's stats)

The Cybertronian Fire:


Ship Name: Cybertronian Fire
Crew Number: 50 (Can hold up to 140)
Armaments: 6 laser batteries, 2 ion cannons, 25 exterior autoguns, shields, 4 
missile launchers.



History:  Three times the size of the Axalon, this standard Maximal battle 
cruiser was constructed  recently in 2302 AD to help subdue growing tension 
between the Maximals and Predacons.  Soon, the Premier Hell Beast stole a 
craft and crashed on Prehistoric Earth by passing through the transwarmp 
anomally still present that leads to a Prehistoric Earth when the Autobots 
and Decepticons were in a state of stasis for four million years in the 
Autobot craft, called the Ark.  After a while, the Maximal Elders got edgy.  
Evidently time hadn't changed at all.  As they could tell.  Maximals were 
still in power.  Interested, they sent the Cybertronian Fire to assist the 
Maximals present on Prehistoric Earth with enough energon adn raw materials 
to build an entire ship, and send back a starhopper or two to tell the Elders 
of the situation.  But, in sight of the planet earth, they were boarded by 
Predacons, who instantly opened fire. The Maximals on the craft stopped them, 
and only the engines were blown to Hell.


Laser Batteries:

There are currently six large, 10 ft high, 5 ft wide twin-barreled laser 
batteries.  Able to fire its double laser bursts once every 2 minutes.  All 
six provide deadly coverfire for the Maximals and any allies of theirs.

EMP Cannons:

The EMP cannons, which are 5 ft high and 3 ft wide,  firing blasts of 
Electro-Magentic Pules.  Knocking out all targets that use unnatural energies 
 (IE: Energon), will short circuit any hit targets, making them immobile.     
The cannons are able to fire once every 3 minutes.

Missile Launchers:

Each missile launcher holds 20 missiles.  Able to fire a maximum of two at 
once.  There are 5 energy-signature seeking missiles, 5 heat seeking 
missiles, and ten normal missiles.  With four missile launchers,  80 
missiles, it is a formidable force alone.

Shields: 

The shields are a mix of ion and plasma, able to block energy and projectile 
weapons.  Including missiles, charges, and other explosives.  There are two 
shield generators deep within the core of the craft that use cold fusion as a 
source of energy.  They can take quite a pounding, giving plenty of time for 
ship defenses to scatter enemies.

Exterior Autoguns:

There are 25 exterior autoguns, firing a mix of lasers and projectile weapons 
at enemies.  Not that strong at this point in the war, they still annoy 
enemies, and may cause them to think unclearly.

Internal Defenses:

In each room, there is a camera.  Of course, they are never on because of 
Maximal privacy, which is taken VERY seriously.  They are only used if they 
have guests that they can't exactly trust.  They are also in every hallway, 
which ARE monitored.  In case...there are any late night invasions.  In each 
room there is a single 
autogun.  Along a hallway, in the walls are a flame thrower on both sides, 
and in the cielings are autoguns.


There are 60 rooms in all.  In each room is a recharge bed, plenty of extra 
spacefor personal belongings and such, and a room to "freshen" up.  As well 
as a personal energon dispensor for when crew members get hunfry.  And, 
windows (with super strong glass), which can be sealed over with a 5 inch 
thick plate of titanium alloy.

Holo-Rooms:

Used for training, relaxation, and tests, the Holo-Rooms is a great accessory.


A large solar panel can be extended from the back of the ship, and gather the 
equivelant of 400 kilos of energon in 1 hour when needed.  Of course, it 
tkaes about 50 kilos worth of energon just to get the solar panels ready.
